Hint1: In the pop-up activity, you'll come across a rectangle where the length and width vary by 3 units. When you drag the corners, the size of the rectangle changes, but that 3-unit difference remains. Try manipulating the rectangle for a bit. As you do, notice how this consistent 3-unit difference between length and width makes the rectangle resemble or not resemble a square.
openPopupDragboard()
When the length and width increase or decrease, how does the 3-unit difference between their lengths affect the ratio of their sizes?

In the pop-up activity, you'll see a rectangle where the length is 3 units more than the width. By adjusting the corners, you can resize the rectangle, keeping this 3-unit difference. Take some time to change the dimensions and observe. While doing this, consider how maintaining this 3-unit difference changes how the rectangle resembles or differs from a square.
openPopupDragboard()
When the length and width either increase or decrease, what effect does the 3-unit difference between the length and width have on the ratio of the dimensions?
